ai.summary: A short, easy 3 km hike from Golspie to the summit of Ben Bhraggie in the Scottish Highlands. The route follows grassy paths to a historic monument, with coastal views over the Moray Firth and a beginner-friendly ascent.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly grassy paths with a gentle to moderate ascent. Some rocky sections near the summit and a few uneven patches underfoot. The final approach is a grassy incline to the monument; expect exposed winds at the top and coastal weather, so dress in layers and wear sturdy footwear.
ai.safety_notes: - Weather can change quickly; check forecasts before you go. - The summit area can be windy and exposed; keep a firm footing and avoid loose ground in wet conditions. - Stay on marked paths; watch for uneven ground and loose stones. - Be mindful of others on the path and keep dogs under control where required. - Tides and coastal spray can affect visibility; plan the return route accordingly. - Respect the historic monument at the summit and avoid climbing on or behind it. - Carry water and a small first-aid kit; have a means to call for help if needed.
ai.best_seasons: Aprilâ€“October; late spring and early autumn offer the best conditions for comfortable walking, while winters can be windy and icy.

seo.title: Golspie to Ben Bhraggie: Easy 3 km Hike in Scotland
seo.meta_description: Embark on an easy 3 km hike from Golspie to Ben Bhraggie in the Scottish Highlands. Grassy paths, a historic summit monument, and coastal views make this a perfect beginner-friendly day out.
seo.h1: Golspie to Ben Bhraggie: Easy 3 km Hike
